metadata.title: CVE-2016-6494 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
The client in MongoDB uses world-readable permissions on .dbshell historyfiles, which might allow local users to obtain sensitive information byreading these files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mongodb - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
mongodb-clients - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
mongodb-server - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
mongodb-server-core - 1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mongodb package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.6.3-0ubuntu1').
